alert.note: Alert for Northern Blaine County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Blaine County through 445 PM MDT... At 359 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Harlem, or 18 miles east of Chinook, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rain, winds in excess of 30 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding and gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hogeland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
